cleaned_text: Naturopath Just like a medical doctor, a naturopathic doctor is a primary care provider. A naturopath can diagnose and treat patients that are injured, sick, and in pain. Instead of relying on western medicine (prescription drugs, radiation, surgery) to suppress the symptoms, they work to find the underlying cause and treat the body as a whole through natural remedies. If you have any questions about our [Ogden UT](/ogden-ut) or [South Jordan UT](/south-jordan-ut) locations, or would like to learn more about naturopath care at Seven Peaks Health Chiropractic, our experienced team at Seven Peaks Health Chiropractic is here to help. What is a Naturopath? Their goal is to prevent and treat acute and/or chronic illness, promote wellness, and restore and establish optimal health by supporting the person's innate ability to heal themselves. Naturopathic practitioners pull from a variety of healing treatments and have multiple treatment options that they can use and treat their patients. Treatments may include nutritional counseling, vitamin injection, supplements, allergy testing, prolotherapy, herbal medicine, prolozone injections, and more. What a naturopath can help with: - Liver Function - Hormone Imbalance - Weight Loss - Thyroid Problems - Nutrient Deficiencies - Anxiety and Depression - Allergies - Acute and Chronic Pains - Gut Health - Food Sensitivity
